context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Govt panel on artificial intelligence, cyber security to submit report soon
context_meta.summary: At a time when data privacy is the key concern for government and citizens alike, Ministry of Electronics and IT formed committees on artificial intelligence (AI) and cyber security are likely to submit their reports soon. The mandate of the panels, which also include top officials from companies like Google, Microsoft, TCS and IBM was to propose action in the areas of platform and data for AI, leveraging AI for identifying national missions in key sectors, mapping technologies, cyber-security, safety, legal and ethical issues. The panel on data for AI will suggest a technical framework or platform for the emerging technology and it would also address data availability resources. The committee

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Interior Department has failed to boost its cyber security since hack
context_meta.summary: A new report published three years after Chinese hackers stole security clearance files and other sensitive personal information from 22 million U.S. federal employees has found cyber security at the servers targeted in the theft is still inadequate. Investigators said cyber defenses at the Department of Interior, which hosted the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) servers, were still unable to pick up 'basic threats', including malware trying to establish contact with Russia. The assessment, by the Interior's own Office of Inspector General, also found technicians had not even got round to implementing a series of mandatory defensive measures announced after the hack. Investigators said cyber

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Cybersecurity fiasco: Interior Department computers trying to talk to Russia, inspectors say
context_meta.summary: Three years after Chinese hackers stole security clearance files and other sensitive personal information of some 22 million U.S. federal employees, cyber-defenses at the Department of Interior, which hosted White House Office of Personnel Management (OPM) servers targeted in the theft, were still unable to detect “some of the most basic threats” inside Interior's computer networks — including malware actively trying to make contact with Russia. In a 16-month examination of Interior's ability to detect and respond to cyber-threats, evaluators from the department's Office of Inspector General (OIG) also discovered that Interior's technicians simply did not implement a sweeping array of mandatory, government-wide defensive measures ordered up after the disastrous OPM hack, didn't investigate blocked intrusion attempts, and left “multiple” compromised computers on their network “for months at a time,” according to a redacted OIG report issued in March.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: General Dynamics (GD) Completes CSRA Acquisition for $9.7B
context_meta.summary: General Dynamics (GD) has now become the largest provider of information technology services to the federal government after acquiring CSRA.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Shares in cyber security group Sophos leap after beating forecasts
context_meta.summary: Shares in Sophos leapt on Thursday as the cyber security company said growth had accelerated in the last three months, reassuring investors following heavy share price falls in recent months. Sophos said that billings - an indicator of future revenues - had grown by 23pc in the three months to the end of March, the final quarter of its fiscal year. It was seen as a reassuring announcement, just three months after the company had revealed a sharp slowdown in growth. During the previous quarter, billings growth had declined sharply from 29pc to 18.7pc, spooking investors.  Analysts said the release of new products was likely to have boosted revenues. They include one used to guard against malicious software that can hijack computers to mine cryptocurrency, a trend that has intensified in recent months. Sophos, which sells antivirus and other cyber defence tools to businesses, has been one of UK's stand-out technology stocks of the last year, boosted by growing corporate fears about cyber attacks launched by criminals and rogue states. sophos shares six months The "WannaCry" global ransomware outbreak that crippled parts of the NHS as well as hundreds of businesses last year was seen as a particularly-crucial driver of growth last year. However, the company's shares have fallen by more than a third since their peak in January as growth appeared to slow down. Private equity group Apax, its biggest shareholder, sold almost half its stake in November.  Apax took Sophos public in 2015 in what was the biggest flotation of a software company in the UK, and a rare example of a technology group choosing London, rather than Wall Street, as a destination. Its value has doubled since then, despite the recent share price declines. On Thursday Sophos said that improved trading meant it was likely to report full-year billings at the top end of previous forecasts when it delivers full-year results next month. The news sent shares up as much as 20pc, before falling back slightly to trade 15.2pc up. Technology intelligence - newsletter promo - EOA However, several analysts warned that the company faces a tough few months maintaining growth, after the boom in business that followed the WannaCry attack in May.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: [24]7.ai Issues Statement on Information Security
context_meta.summary: PR Newswire SAN JOSE, Calif., April 4, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- [24]7.ai discovered and contained an incident potentially affecting the online customer payment information of a small number of our client companies, and affected clients have been notified. The incident began on Sept. 26, and was discovered and contained on Oct. 12, 2017. We have notified law enforcement and are cooperating fully to ensure the protection of our clients and their customers' online safety. We are confident that the platform is secure, and we are working diligently with our clients to determine if any of their customer information was accessed. About [24]7.ai [24]7.ai is redefining the way companies interact with consumers.
